title: Not accepting new patients
body: I was disappointed as on the website it sais that they accept new patients but when I went there they informed me that they don’t.

title: My care
body: I felt listened to, reassured and Safe with my counsellor. I felt I gain more insight in managing my low moods and Learnt new skills and methods to manage my behaviour.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust o

title: Great use of technology
body: Econsult with the Doctor regarding my ankle. The doctor wanted to see my ankle so he video called me which gave him a better understanding of my ailment. This made the consultation just as good and personal as a standard practice appointment.

title: Always Impressed
body: We are so lucky having such a good Doctors' practice.  From reception, through to cleaners, admin,  nurses and doctors, everyone is so professional while still being thoughtful, caring and efficient.  I feel very lucky being registered to this practice.  I salute and thank you all for your excellent work.

title: Good practice
body:
I’ve always had a positive experience at the alwoodley medical centre. Doctors knowledgable and approachable, nurses friendly and caring. 

Reception staff have improved in the past couple of years in my opinion.

title: Proactive, positive listening practice
body:
I’ve been so impressed by the doctors in this practice. They have gone out of their way to help my father. They listened to my concerns and took decisive, positive action. They really listened to me. 
It is comforting to know that they are looking after my father.

title: Brilliant.
body:
My 92 yr old father had to have a battery change in his pacemaker. At the appointed time we were met by the same nurse that had carried out his pre-assessment, who he recognised from a previous visit. He was happily whisked away for the procedure until I returned to collect him at the end of the day. I was met by my dad, surrounded by 3 nurses now, all of them laughing and smiling along with dad. He had been thoroughly spoilt by them during his stay apparently, even enjoying sausages and mash !
Thank you, thank you, thank you for what did. For a 92 yr old. with mild dementia, you made his day.

readBy.name: King's College Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Lovely staff
body:
I had to take my 3 year old to A and E this afternoon for treatment of a facial wound (with my 5 year old in tow!). 

All of the staff we met were so kind and helpful and went out of their way to reassure my anxious 3 year old. We were seen quickly, and the nurse who treated my son was so good with children. Her calm manner was exactly what my son needed and I am so grateful to her.

title: Exceptional service during difficult times
body: I am extremely impressed by the service received at this practice. To actually see a doctor and feel he has time to listen to you to discuss your problem and also perform minor surgery when necessary is quite refreshing during these difficult times.

title: Best patience care
body: I would like to thank all the nurses and doctors and staff on ward f5 for taking the best care in making sure I had a speedy safe recovery after having a heart attack and emergency treatment to have a stent fitted. I can’t fault any of the care I received to ensure I got to make a speedy recovery ready to go home. All the staff was very attentive taking care of all my needs and taking good care of me. I was especially grateful for them even looking after my wife whilst she sat waiting for me after my operation and letting letting her briefly visit me afterwards in what must of been a worrying time for her. Thanks very much I’m eternally grateful to all of you.

readBy.name: Plymouth University Urgent and Emergency Care Bsc (2020)

title: Outstanding treatment and care
body:
Had a very sudden admission for a 5 day plasma exchange, referred by ophthalmology, overseen by neurology and with treatment from the renal ward. I can not put into words how humbled, impressed and truly grateful I am to absolutely every professional who treated me, especially the lovely nurse who came in twice on her days off to make sure I had continous treatment. The patience, quality of care, friendliness and professionalism of staff was superb. Everyone communicaed what was happening, at every stage of my treatment and I can't thank everyone enough. 
We are blessed to have such an amazing team looking after the people of Sunderland.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very professional
body: I was referred by my GP to call 999 to arrange transport, after she said that I had had a stroke, which I did. I was seen fairly quickly in A & E, where basic diagnostics took place. It was busy, but calm and orderly. Usual tests carried out, and a chest X-ray and a CT scan were arranged. Questioned by a doctor about my symptoms, and afte the CT scan confirmed that I had had a stroke I was taken to the Stroke ward. which was fairly quiet by mid-evening. I was asked to stay overnight to see a consultant. All the staff were very attentive and helpful. I was treated well by professionals. After seeing the consultant, I went for a Doppler scan, which the doctor assessed. All the tests pointed towards a stroke, and I was prescribed a number of drugs. I was allowed to go home by around 2.00 PM. At no time did I feel unsafe, given the hospital was in the middle of the CROVID emergency. Thanks to all the staff I came across during my 'visit', who were uniformly excellent.

title: Disappointing  service
body:
After an initial  phone interview  was informed that the service would be able to help with the problems I was experiencing.
I was surprised  to be offered this help in  a couple of weeks. 
During this appointment  I was informed that I was being discharged from the service because my score was too low to warrant their services and time. 
The problems I presented with are still there  plus feel extremely let down by the service .

title: 4th Floor South STAFF
body:
I am  humbly grateful  and satisfied to visit this Hospital today. reception staff was  very professionally dressed and attentive to  all patients, their commutation skills were clear and understanding to my  needs. No long waiting both male and female staff were magnificent. All  the  staff on  the 4th floor  were brilliant in Care needs, listening and informing skills. Consultants, Nurses, Theatre, Anaesthetist, Health Care Assistant  and Kitchen Staff every single Staff  I came  into contact with preformed  Team Effort  and  was  very  very  Kind, Explained everything before  proceeding provided me with Choices, Dignity, Respect  and  Safety … I am  so very grateful  I  cannot  Thank you  enough  WELLINGTON HOSPITAL  SOUTH 4th Floor … Annmarie Blackman-Corraspe ..
thank you

title: Shocking Receptionist - Scared to call in future.
body: Doctors are fantastic if you can navigate the rude, abrupt and unprofessional receptionist [not all receptionists btw]. On multiple occasions a particular staff member, interrupts, speaks over, patronises and disconnects calls whilst you're still talking with a parting sarcastic "Goodbye". We live in society with vulnerable, elderly and people with mental health complexities trying to access essential medical support, this could act as a deterrent to securing the help they need simply because they cannot face the interaction with the practices front office. As a family we cannot face further interactions like this when we should be concentrating on the salient point for contacting your community doctors practice - health. We have unfortunately took the decision to leave Maghull Family Surgery which is a shame as the doctors we have interacted with have been incredible. It is frightening to think that there is such self appointed empowerment and autonomy assumed by people who then act as gatekeepers to essential critical services. As per the conditions of review publication I have omitted items relating to examples of malpractice and instead submitted these to the care quality commission. Until there are front office changes I would avoid this surgery at all costs.

title: A generally Good Surgery
body: On the whole a good surgery with most staff who are conscientious and respectful. The practice manager does his best to mediate in all circumstances to the best of his abilities. As long as you don’t point out anything which is failing in local health and care systems or their own practice, too much, you will be treated well or at least with a good level of impartiality. The surgery has its values in the right place, but would be greatly improved by working with patient centred approaches involving them in their care, to improve patient experience. They are however, as helpful as they can be and are generally very busy, which could cause concerns for safeguarding patients at times. Booking appointments are still difficult years on despite feedback, but I am a little reticent these days. A generally Good Surgery that would be improved significantly by taking into active consideration, the feedback of all patients to improve patient safety, primary health care provision and public confidence in NHS services.

title: Quick & polite!
body:
Proper protocols were followed due to COVID-19, which I definitely appreciate! I arrived 10 minutes early and waited a mere 5 minutes before I was seen. The pelvic ultrasound took all of 5 minutes and the doctor and nurse were very warm and polite.

My only issue is that I wasn’t told when to contact my GP for results. But other than that, it was excellent.

title: Lack of communication
body:
Not the first time I have been held to ransom by having a repeat prescription withheld or altered due to no reason other than a total lack of communication from GPs who seem unable or unwilling to pick up the telephone and speak to the patient themselves. They depend too much on asking receptionists to do this which leads to unnecessary confusion.
Timekeeping by GPs for appointments is usually terrible, waiting half an hour is the norm.  Receptionists often give out incorrect information on the phone and an automatic booking in system is long overdue.

title: Overall efficiency
body:
Thank you for the very efficient and speedy way in which I was treated for a skin issue. This could have been skin cancer but was benign. The initial phone call and photographic evidence , the booking in at hospital and subsequent attendance and treatment at Warwick was performed with great efficiency. The diagnostic letter came in just over 2 week saving a lot of worry waiting.
Thank you all very much.

title: Absolutely amazing
body: I wouldn’t even know where to start. I went in for a surgical abortion and for anyone this is a hard time as it is. From the women at the desk to the women down stairs every single one Off them shown this isn’t just a job for them. They took pride in every single person. Absolutely amazing. And I am one who was Overly nervous. Read every single review to just see how it was. And I experienced it for myself. The staff don’t get the recognition they deserve.

title: Amazing
body:
-Effective comunication & follow up across patients' needs.
-Really understand the fundermental values nhs represents.
-Polite & very knowledgeable.Always run an extra mile to understand patients.
-Quick to respond to online services.
-Involve patients in issues relating to their queries & seek to make patients understand the underlying circumstances
-Members of staff are calm & willing to listen to patients at least for all moments I have been about.
-Effective reminders to patients in matters regarding future health possibilities.

A huge thank u

title: Knee replacement
body:
By Brian Childs

I would like to pass on my thanks to all those involved in my surgery, the surgeon, anaesthetist, theatre staff, nurses and all other non medical staff involved. The professionalism and care shown was excellent and they should be commended for all they do especially during the coronavirus pandemic.

Operation June 8th 2020

title: Great Service and Result
body: Following first consultation I felt confident in the consultant who agreed that I needed two knee replacements. In a month or so the first one was done and the whole experience was excellent. I was home inside 48 hours with the home service calling in next day to reinforce the messages from the physios. 5 months later I was in on a Saturday for the other knee. Once again everything went well and the consultant visited me on the ward 4 times during my short stay. Fantastic service. I am happy to report that 22 months after the first op it has been life changing and a total success. My whole experience with ROH was totally positive and supportive from every member of staff and I would recommend ROH to anyone.

title: Inhuman discharge policy
body:
Terrible. I never once had an appointment. I attended my first scheduled appointment and the therapist failed to even turn up. I then had two subsequent appointments that I forgot to attend and was immediately discharged (double standards...). It's worth noting that I have ADHD, and my tendency to forget appointments is indicative of the fact I need therapy in the first place! They must have a more compassionate discharge policy, and put in more effort to contact people like me (for example, phoning from an anonymous number, leaving more frequent text reminders), before dismissing without any notice. Despite my forgetfulness, I was extremely responsive to my therapist's messages, but could not even respond after being discharged to fight the decision.

I now have to refer myself again to the service, which took 4 months the first time round - so back to square one. I feel like I am being punished for my condition. In another 4 months, I could lose my job again, I could spiral into an even worse state than I am now.

Unless they put in the effort, vulnerable people like myself will never even get to meet their therapist and will frankly never get better. Getting the help you need should not be an uphill battle.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Excellent Service/Support
body: I cannot praise highly enough the professionalism, commitment, compassion and support provided by all the staff during a stressful aqueus shunt surgical procedure I undertook on the 16.06.20 For almost 30 years I have been extremely lucky to have this fantastic institution treat me for glaucoma. A heartfelt thank you.

title: Brilliant place
body: Brilliant place, friendly people and very helpful. Would recommend for anyone. Very clean and safe .

title: rude receptionist
body: I went in with a Spanish student who was studying and staying with me at the time. The receptionist was very abrupt and quite hostile towards us. She kept us standing around for a long time until another member of staff asked her if we could sit now. My student had a European health card and was entitled to use the service.

title: First class treatment.
body:
My husband came into your hospital by Ambulance to A & E and then went onto a ward.  His treatment by all the staff that took care of him were amazing.  From the time the Ambulance came and the girls were great and all the staff were wonderful.  They saved his life and we are so grateful and feel lucky to have such a great hospital.
Also the home care from the oxygen staff has also been amazing and we can not praise them enough and they make you feel good and confident about the treatment and at ease and have also given us a number to call if there are any problems.  So thank you all, you are special  people.

title: First Rate Practice
body:
The way the practice runs is ,in my view , exceptional.  The Walk in Clinic  is fantastic. Of course, there is sometimes a wait to see a doctor but you know you will see one . 
During the current Covid crisis this facility has been suspended however you can call and speak to a doctor .
Unusually for me I have had cause to have to do this twice. Both times I have  telephoned I have spoken to polite and helpful reception staff who have put through to equally kind and helpful doctors . Both doctors took time to listen to my concerns without making me feel I was taking to much of their time in what must be an extremely busy time for them . A big thank you to all concerned.
We all to often here about how difficult it is to get GP's appointments and how awful the whole system is. Well I think Paxton Green are doing a great job and their system  is excellent. I have been a patient  for over 20 years and would not ever want to be a patient Anywhere  else.  Well done to everybody who plays a part at the practice. Keep up the fantastic work !

title: First class service
body:
Had to go in as I had a suspected detached retina. Entrance into hospital well controlled and very friendly, as was the entrance into the Ophthalmology Dept. I was particularly impressed with the thought that had gone into reducing the viral load of the doctors - prior to my examination, I was in the treatment room by myself an described the problem and symptoms via telephone. Then the doctor examined me in person. A simple, but effective way of dealing with the enforced changes all of the NHS has had to face.
Exiting the department and the hospital was again friendly and well controlled. 
Many thanks to all concerned!

title: Superb Care from beginning to end
body: Ever since I first saw my consultant last year for my Fibroid problem, I have received first class care. He took the time to explain both to my husband and myself what kind of treatments were available. Last week I had a hysterectomy at Burnley and received excellent care. All the staff showed the upmost professionalism and gave me a fantastic level of care. Due to Covid, my husband was not able to accompany me to the ward or even visit, but he was kept fully informed when he rang the ward.  My entire experience from start to finish has been superb, considering that I was having a major operation. Please pass on my thanks to all the staff.

title: Excellent small hospital
body: I was extremely nervous about having a procedure to remove skin cancer on my leg.  From entering the hospital I was well looked after by very friendly staff who put me at ease.  I was talked through what would happen and during the op I was kept calm by lovely nurses who talked to me the whole time.  Afterwards I was able to have a cup of tea and biscuits to relax before leaving. It was a much better experience than I had expected. If I needed hospital treatment again I would like it to be at the Cobalt if possible.

title: Good service in A & E
body: I went to A&E after falling off a ladder doing DIY.  It was quite busy and there was some waiting involved, but all the staff I saw (reception, triage nurses, doctor, x-ray team) were kind and professional and I was very happy with the service.

title: disgrace  service
body: i had a appointment to see my farther in law in caple  ward it was arranged the day before so i paid car park then when i got to the ward i was then told he was moved to Woodbridge  ward who then told me that i could not see him as there was too many people on that ward i had no call from either ward to say that he was moved to a different ward  this is a disgrace from the incompetent staff who could not be bothered to call me to say he was moved and would not refund me the car park fee and then i was told by someone in charge that they do not call anyone to say that the person you want see has been moved i would not trust them to do anything right

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful department
body:
From the moment I entered the 'Endoscopy  department until leaving I was treated superbly, Everyone explaining in detail all that was happening at each step of the process. 
What an amazing well organised professional department fully deserving of a   ***** ++  rating.

title: So understanding
body: Admitted to ward and luckily my gyne consultant was on duty he understood my pain as he knew my back ground and again fully listened and made a plan. Due to have abdominal hysterectomy in 4 weeks at the age of 29 so nervous and he has always put me at ease always has his listening ears on and so kind to me as a patient. Lovely lovely man the nurses have been great too keeping on top of my pain. Thank you all and to my wonderful male gyne consultant who has gone above and beyond in my care. How lucky to have him working for our nhs!

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great experience!!
body:
Just like to let you know how very impressed i was with my first visit to St Richards A & E department 
From the reception to the porters doctors X-ray staff and back again everyone was so polite,friendly,helpful and professional at every point of my visit 
At my age I have been in a number of different hospitals over the years but I have to say this is by far the best treatment I have received on my short visit to your hospital 
With all the pressure your staff are under during this current crisis I can only congratulate them all on their professionalism and dedication to their work 
Thank you so very much 
Diane Pugh (Mrs) age 74
Visited Tuesday 16th June 2020

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Kind and caring
body: Visited the ENT Dept on 19th June 2020, 9.30 am.  I was  worried as this was a fast-track referral.  However, my daughter was allowed to come in with me and I was seen immediately. The doctor/consultant was very polite and put me at ease at once. The examination was carefully carried out and I couldn’t have wished for a better experience ( in the circumstances ).  From the volunteer who showed us where to go, to the nurse on ENT, thank you all very much.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Poor service
body: I have not had very good experiences in the Practice and am going to leave.  A couple of the receptionist and administrator are negative and talk about you even when you are waiting to be seen. More recently I asked for help in a medical condition. The doctor told me that they were going to email and contact me, but nothing has been done. When I've rung to get repeat prescriptions I've been made to feel bad to the point that I do not use the pharmacy any more. It's a pity as some of the doctors are really good.

title: CCU, Ward 4, Diuretics Absolutely outstanding care
body:
My wife had a cardioversion some while ago and received exemplary after care via the staff in diuretics and heart specialist after care but recently suffered a major downturn.
She was admitted to ward 4 almost immediately and had simply outstsnding car before being transferred to coronrary care (CCU)
Exceptional care in this ward followed, resulting in her being home less than 2 weeks later.
Follow up by district nurse, physios etc has been unbelievably good

NHS take a bow!

title: What a turnaround
body: Myself had many issues over the years and at times I have been shocked with the care previously given however since the previous doctors have left,  this surgery has turned around. I have seen the nurses , the advanced nurse practitioner and the female doctor  , I have to say they were absolutely brilliant, caring , they listened, for the first time in years I have faith in this surgery. This surgery has gone up in my expectations. I understand that this surgery was run to the ground but this surgery has transformed and I would urge anyone to register here. They are doing a fantastic job. I have never had a problem with the receptionists but I have been a medical receptionist and it is a very pressured busy role, don’t take it personal but sometimes it can come across that we look unhappy but it isn’t that it is a tiring role and a challenging role and we all have them off days. They are nice receptionists trying to adapt to new challenges and change. Well done to you all.

title: Brilliant service
body: Attended to my ankle injury really efficiently with great care from all concerned. All the staff were very friendly and kind. Maybe I struck lucky but the whole thing including an X-ray took about 40 minutes. Thank you to a great team.

title: No empathy
body: The receptionist was very unsympathetic and advised I register with a new doctor for my 94 year old mother who is dying of heart failure.  Advised the GP would not attend a home visit because she is temporarily staying 1 mile further from her usual address.  I would not recommend this practise to anyone.

title: Terrible
body: I have been visiting this drs for 20 + years and am now currently looking to switch to another surgery. I suffer with depression and am struggling on the medication I have been provided with, therefore looking to change anti depressant. Over the past month or so I have been calling to speak to one specific dr who I feel comfortable talking with and who knows my background as I need to change to a different anti depressant. Each time I called the surgery I was told to call on a specific day the following week as the dr I wanted to speak with wasn’t working. So I would. This happened 4 times!!! All the while i am slowly running out of my current meds. I even asked if I could be contacted when she’s next in and that wasn’t an option. Not once was I told that it wasn’t definite that the dr would be in work on those occasions. So each time I called I would mention that I was told to call on this specific day and I would just get told by the receptionists “well she’s not in”. If I had been told at the start that drs are not guaranteed to be in work on the days specified then I would of course had to speak with a different dr! I have now had to go back onto sertraline just to keep the anti depressant in my system. I ran out of the drug for a week and suffered horrific side effects - no thanks to TMC! The surgery may be working on a rota but any decent surgery would let their patients know that there is a possibility drs won’t be in on the days they specify! They have zero care for people’s well-being and have not bothered responding to the email I sent to them over a week ago. I don’t think they realise they have a duty of care! I am now in the process of switching doctors and would not recommend this surgery at all. If I could give it no stars I would. I understand we are at the tail end of a pandemic but that does not mean they can fob their patients off and show no duty of care. So thank you TMC for your incompetence and negligence, I’ll be sure to inform anybody that is thinking of joining you NOT TO!

title: Changed my life
body: I cannot recommend this clinic enough. I used to suffer from intense, trauma induced, triggers every single day. They were often so bad that I was unable to hold down a job. A Senior Cognitive Behaviour Therapist at this clinic advised I tried EMDR therapy. I was skeptical at first but they were very understanding and talked me through the whole process, suggesting we trial it first. After a handful of sessions I can safely say that my triggers are down by as much as 95%. So much emotional pain and anger has gone, it's like I have woken out of a nightmare. I have tried a few types of therapy but nothing has been so immediate. I simply cannot recommend this clinic enough, it has changed my life.

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust

title: New staff actually listen!
body: I have been living in the area for a while. The phones would take forever to be answered. But it seems there are new staff and new doctors. The place has become caring and they sorted out my referral and tablets very quickly. Much happier now than how it was.

title: Professionalism combined with care and warmth
body:
I was visiting my family who live in the South Hams in Chillington, sitting outside in the garden for social distancing. 
Without warning I had a tremendous spasm in my leg with agonising pain.  
My daughter rang the emergency services.  An ambulance was dispatched immediately from Totnes, and arrived as quickly as the roads allowed.  By then the spasms and pain had abated.  The two ambulance team were absolutely terrific.
They did the most thorough check - up of my condition, with all the appropriate tests.  Another doctor also arrived but soon afterwards departed as it was clear that there was no further need for support.  
Once all the necessary checks had been carried out and proved that all was in order, the senior medic telephoned a consultant at Torbay Hospital, to make sure it had not been caused by DVT to the leg.  He confirmed that everything was fine with none of the signs that would indicate this was the cause of the problem.
I am blessed with good health and never have occasion to require the emergency services.  How reassuring that when the need arises, you are met by such professionalism and care.  The ambulance crew were meticulous and thorough in their check-ups and I am completely restored to full health now.
I would like to use this opportunity to sincerely thank them for their help.   My two young grandchildren were present when I had this problem with my leg and it greatly helped them seeing the medical team sorting out and checking in such a warm, and compassionate way.
I just wanted to record the appreciation of my wife and family for the support and help that I received.   Thank you so much.  What a wonderful service we have In the N.H.S.

title: Starting to feel let down no time for patients
body:
Tarnished with the brush of other people without any clear evidence, no time to sit down and actually listen to the patient anymore, making assumptions and telling me how I feel about a situation, since when do doctors tell you how you should be feeling, isn’t that the point in going to see a doctor, been a patient a long time and my children have been patients since birth, but I equally feel let down by the practice with support ( lack of) given for them, no continuity in seeing the same doctors. They change the doctors like the weather, most importantly the receptionists think they are medically trained and always ask what your medical issue is before booking you in, this in my opinion is unacceptable. 
I won’t be recommending the practice to anyone.
Feeing let down and not listened to.

title: Excellent Care
body: I received excellent care from the Stroud General Hospital - the staff were attentive, efficient and supportive, and I would wholeheartedly recommend their services.

title: Great compassionate practice
body: I attended with chest pains early sun morn21st June . The male nurse and male doctor were so lovely and professional . I was so worried I was wasting their precious time . Thankyou

title: Amazing
body: Admitted to the emergency ward on 12th june with suspected appendicitis. Shortly afterwards moved to Clapham ward. The girls on both wards were super amazing throughout my stay. I was terrified of having surgery and they and the anesthetist completely put my mind at rest. At all points I felt safe and well cared for and they couldn't do enough for me. Thank you so much for making my first experience of surgery so easy

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: Always accommodating, and go the extra mile to calm your anxieties. Service is second to none and all staff are so helpful.  Would highly recommend

title: Needed assistance
body: I have anxiety issues and struggle to talk to new people and stutter a lot. On telling the staff in AnE they still would not let my girlfriend come in with me to help keep me calm and explain why I am here.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Couldn’t do more!
body:
As soon as I arrived the nurse made sure to come over and check my temperature and ask questions about COVID to make sure everyone was safe guarded. 
Everyone was very pleasant and took the time to listen about my problem, I also was seen quickly. I left feeling confident and comfortable knowing what steps I needed to take next. I would definitely recommend. 
Everyone is doing such a great job! Thank you

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: My sons super heros
body: My son is a payient at the moment on ITU. I just have to say as family not being able to be with him, how utterly phenomenal all the staff are. They have gone above and beyond to help us cope and have, for sure saved my sons life. They are truly wonderful staff. How proud the hospital must be of them. Thank you just isnt enough x

title: Excellent Treatment
body: I attended A&E on the 20.6.20. Everyone I met was extremely, friendly, helpful, kind end caring. The A&E nurse was totally professional and understanding. The junior doctor was extremely professional, had excellent interpersonal skills, was an active listener and it was obvious they wanted to make a difference. The junior doctor will be a fabulous consultant and an asset to the hospital.

title: Believe it or not, it's the 21st century!
body:
If only because of the restrictions of COVID-19, it should be possible to contact the surgery by email rather than the totally restricted 500 character online form. Nothing meaningful can be detailed in such brevity whereas as an email to a generic (secretaries@) email address I could provide more helpful information to determine whether an (or what type of) appointment is needed.

Instead, if I want to provide something useful beyond the paltry 500 characters, I have to write a letter, go out to buy a stamp and then post it. This is inconvenient. This is unhelpful to the GP. This is inefficient.

It's the 21st century!

title: Fantastic service
body: I rang 111 at 08.30 on a Sunday morning and was offered Bristol Eye Hospital as an option for treating my ocular emergency.  Registration was easy and the nurse assessor was very prompt.  My problem was dealt with immediately by her and her colleague.  It was a smooth operation delivered in a friendly and professional manner.  I left the department in under 45 minutes with allotters dealt with.  As a former GP, I was very impressed indeed.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Bristol and Weston NHS Foundation Trust

title: Highly recommend this practice
body:
During Covid-19 outback I have needed treatment but due to my mental illness I was extremely worried to visit the doctor, but this practice could not of been anymore reassuring and helpful to me than they have been I really cannot thank them enough. 
 Since joining this practice they have always done everything they can to help me, I really do owe my life to the doctors here for there medical care that they have given me.

title: Warm, pleasant and professional service
body: Overal my CT Scan today was quick, no waiting and total professional. I had to ask directions and the gentleman was pleasant and informative. However, what made me take the time to find and give this feedback was the lady on XRay Reception (5.30pm Sunday afternoon 21/06/2020) was welcoming, smartly dressed, professional and above all a breath of fresh air. It was a pleasure to meet her and although there are additional procedures for Covid she dealt with my booking in, in as normal way as possible. Thank you. Mick R

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great team!
body: I was very impressed of attitude of all staff in this GP. Very kind team and receptive. Time of waiting is short and all my problems were solved immediately. I am so grateful for all hard work of all members of staff especially now in this difficult times for us.

title: very professional
body: I had waited 3 months for a colonoscopy (because of coronavirus). I was very nervous. The staff at the Endoscopy Suite were very professional and caring. They put me at ease and talked me through everything. The sister who looked after me in recovery was very reassuring. The follow up by the Specialist Screening Practitioner was exceptional. I was put at ease after the procedure and the follow up phone calls.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Exceptional Doctor
body: My GP  has always been knowledgeable and helpful she is an exceptional doctor.I am very happy with her service.The receptionists do seem to face a lot of pressures but have always tried to help me. Thank you to all.

title: Amazing experience with staff
body:
My consultant phoned me on 17 June 2020 to give me the result(s) of - and treatment for - my recent biopsy. He was as usual polite, professional and yet able to explain the details in layman's terms to me. I am extremely pleased to follow his advice and directions. He has been remarkable throughout all my visits.
The two nursing staff who perormed the biopsy were calming, professional and kind. Even the reception lady was pleasant and polite. I believe the 'team' work really well together and this really enhances the whole environment. Overall my experience with dermatology at Canterbury hospital has been very positive amazing (despite my biopsy being for potential cancer cells...  Thank you. Jean B

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Getting much better
body: The staff are friendly and try to help. Maybe I've struck lucky but in recent times of need, I have been seen pretty promptly.  I don't mind which doctor I see...they all seem fine to me.

title: Unable to book routine GP appointments.
body:
The booking system is very poor. There is very little flexibility, you have to book non urgent appointment exactly one week in advance and even then you are not able to be booked in and have to call back on another day. I initially chose the surgery due to their extended opening hours on a Thursday and on Saturdays but it has become more or less important to make routine appointments with a GP. 
It is very difficult to get through on the phone line. Often the phone is just engaged, you are not even put on hold. 
Despite having online access you are not able to book routine GP appointments. 
I have experienced rude behaviour by the receptionist. 
I have never seen the same GP twice. 
I would not recommend this surgery to any patients.

title: Awful Patient care
body:
Booked appt well in advance - text confirmation received confirming the appt - fine up to this point.

When turned up for the Appt on the day at 1645 hrs for 1700hrs - 15 mins early, only to be told that I had missed the appt apparently brought bought to 1420 hrs without informing me. Then insisted a voice mail was left only which was not true. That followed I could be seen having waited for further 45 Mins then told no one was there to see me. The worst still when asked if another appt can be arranged answer was come back next week. Awful Awful Awful....... I wish they could be held to acct. I am healthy individual and rarely use NHS and this was for routine Healthcheck Appt I was asked to attend.

title: Amazing
body: Popped in yesterday and given appointment for 11am today, reception very friendly and helpful. Coincidentally my prescription (placed Monday) was ready and waiting. The appointment was with a particular doctor at Giggs Hill.  She was phenomenal 10/10.  We have bloods Monday, had an X-ray at Surbiton HC today at 12.30 and see her in 3 weeks.  Wow when it works the NHS is a credit to all who work in it and ya for paying National Insurance 😀.  Based on this experience the review couldn’t be positive enough.

title: System and Administration Failings
body:
I am posting this comment on Wednesday 25th February 2020 for my experience of this practice on the same date. 

I tried to call this practice on the telephone (01582 346259) at about 09.00am this morning.

My first 10 call attempts all failed, number engaged tone.
    
Now Gardenia and Marsh Farm practice I suggest that when a patient needs to speak to their GP surgery they are not going to stop trying to get through.  They are just going to keep redialling, and I did.
 
So, 10 call attempts rejected with engaged. …..Your systems are not very good are they? 

Why are you trying to limit the number of people trying to get through on the telephone?

Then when I did manage to get through on the number; I learnt, so you say, that you apparently have an intelligent call queueing system that allows more calls reducing how often you hear the engaged tone. Really, that was not my experience today. 

Anyway my call was placed in a queue……… at position 14….. …and then took over 18 minutes to get to call position 1 for answering.    

So it seems that it’s not only the administration systems but also Practice Management at the Gardenia and Marsh Farm practice that is not very good.....at doing the simplest of things....having a sufficient resource to answer the telephone. 

Perhaps the Gardenia and Marsh Farm Practice would like to respond in a timely manner to how they are going to address these failings.

author: Nonay023
title: Women’s Service St Andrews Hospital Northampton
body:
Yet another “inadequate” CQC report for St Andrews, Northampton, this time for the Women’s service.  
Does make you wonder how many times St Andrews is placed in Special Measures before they are completely closed down. It doesn’t surprise me that the women’s service was rated as “Requiring Improvement” in the effectiveness category as only DBT is offed on Hereward Wake Ward regardless of the patient’s needs or history.  
Although they were also rated “Inadequate” in the Caring, category this has not been our experience on Hereward Wake Ward which clearly has some compassionate and committed staff members

links.id: range of psychological therapies on offer

author: Cornishmen
title: Receiving my images became a problem
body: I had a MRI scan here privately and wish that I hadn't. The scan its self went well, it was the process of recieving my images and being able to pass them on which became a problem. The images aren't provided on a cd rom and instead are emailed to you via a link which you have to wait 3 weeks for. The images where of poor quality on the email link and this made it difficult for my consultant to give me a confident diagnosis. Not all private consultants have access to the NHS image sharing system. I have since paid to have my scan at another private hospital where I received my images on a disc the same day and have since taken them back to my chosen consultant. This has cost me about another 500 pounds and delayed me in getting the correct diagnosis.

author: yankeekd99
title: Believing I could change
body:
I would like to thank Telford Stars and my worker Michelle for having the belief that I could change.  
Without that support, I would not be here now.

author: Webbetta
title: Telephone consultation
body: I was called by my consultant who was very informative and helpful. I felt well cared for and listened to. My opinion was taken into the outcome. I was very satisfied.

title: Passed around, unsupported, failed promises
body: Following suicidal thoughts I got a referral to talking therapies. They did not ring at the scheduled time and they discharged me. Much legwork resulted in my being offered cbt face to face. I was really pleased but the 1 hour plus first session resulted in the therapist essentially saying I was too bad for cbt, (I had had a crisis recently, involving Samaritans) and they should come to me rather than me go to them. Disappointed I accepted this. But no one came. I have in the last 3 months had three phone calls, amounting to a further 2.5 hours of assessment and my having no clue what could be on the horizon. After more of my own pushing and legwork and co fusion I am finally told I will get a navigator and a transformer, (whatever one of them might be). No promised reports have arrived. I have still no named professional. I wait for any care plan. Essentially I have been largely left in a highly vulnerable position, suffering some horrific weekends with st's, unsupported. I have waited week after week after week left in the dark. 5 hours of assessment to date, passed around, and still have no help. A completely ineffective and time wasting service to date. It's been ten months now since my initial referral. I note the parallels of my story to the other reviews here, which are also reminiscence of the "service" I received 8 years ago when I was also passed around as I was too "complicated" and yes, ultimately discharged. Whilst not my intention, it is entirely possible that I could have succumbed to intrusive thoughts, and there would be no come back as dead men don't complain. I can't comment on any therapy or direct help as there has been none. However, whilst all people have been polite and professional it is absolutely clear that organization and management of cases is a compete sham. 5 hours of assessment over ten months, zero input. This service is an insult to its clients, needs demolishing, and rebuilding properly from the ground up.

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

author: royal navy
title: Suspected dvt
body:
I phoned my gp worried in case I had a dvt in my right leg as I have a large bakers cyst on back of leg and awaiting revision knee replacement. The swelling was that bad my gp sent me to Sunderland royal ward d44. The care and treatment was brilliant couldn't fault the staff at all and especially under the circumstances, they are in ten out of ten.  
I was treated with the utmost respect and courtesy. I was admitted Thursday & they took blood and done a scan, all was clear, just waiting now for revision.

readBy.name: South Tyneside and Sunderland NHS Foundation Trust

title: Terrible
body: This is a terrible service and I can see why. Had assessments over 2 weeks and despite being diagnosed with PTSD was told that they could not help with my condition. Was extremely shocked and left with no alternative. Very poor. Would not recommend

readBy.name: Tees, Esk and Wear Valleys NHS Foundation Trust

author: emalou
title: Ibd services
body:
My daughter was diagnosed with colitis.and discharged just before lockdown.As a result we have been learning how to manage the condition.  
The ibd team are most helpful with advice and have listed with gp's sending emails to change medication etc.  
My daughter is very grateful as I am.  
She also received excellent care in the hospital in ward 17 and 18.  
She was very ill on admission

author: caravaner41
title: Speech and Language Therapist
body:
My dad had a stroke and then was diagnosed with dementia.  
A speech and language therapist, Margaret, came to visit him and she had a lovely interaction with him - it was amazing. Then she has been supporting me in understanding how to help him. She's never been threatening or demanding, has kept in touch, understood when I can't talk, she's easy to talk to and has listened to me.  
She's provided links to information on Recap and using life story work has stimulated him. I think introducing music he knows will help too and she's also sent support for followup.  
I just want to say 'thank you very much'.

readBy.name: Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: Calqy33
title: Receiving multiple duplicate SMS messages
body:
I wanted to share this story as I really hope that highlighting this issue may help solve a problem and hopefully cut costs for my GP practice/s.  
This morning I have received a text from my two GP practices that are collaboratively run. these are the Stag Medical Centre and Rose Court Surgery in Wickersley, Rotherham.  
No complaints about the practices themselves, rather, their seems to be a problem with their SMS communication system.  
Firstly, I just want t say it's great that more services are utilising SMS messaging, it saves them from the cost and admin cost of sending out postal letters, and is super efficient and accessible when working well. Plus, during the pandemic, it definitely seems like the safe and speedier option to get important info out fast, so it's great to see this happening.  
On April 14th, a message was sent to patients encouraging us to sign up to the electronic prescription service.  
I received this SMS message at 9:38am, 9:39am and 9:41am. I assumed there was a problem and perhaps someone had accidentally clicked 'send' twice, but when the third text arrived I thought surely that can't happen three times. When just 2 texts had arrived I wondered if it was my fault and maybe I'd accidentally given them my details twice? But that doesn't really make sense either. Perhaps the system has duplicates and they weren't sent three times, but some people's numbers were in the system multiple times? I'm not sure. Either way, I thought oh gosh I hope that hasn't cost them triple the amount of money it needed to. Plus, and I know this sounds really petty in the scheme of things, but it was slightly annoying receiving three of the same message while trying to work.  
I considered sharing feedback at the time, but there's no obvious way to do so and I assumed they would be very aware of this mistake and would have fixed it. When I received a new message about signing up to the health app on April 15th, and only received it once, I thought, great! They've fixed the issue, no need to feedback.  
But then today (12/06/20) I've been sent the same message 4 times. It's about wearing a mask when attending the surgery, obviously very important info to send out but it would seem the problem hasn't been fixed. I received this same message at 8:48, 9:26, 9:53 and 10:19am. Again, really quite annoying. Plus, if I wasn't working I think I'd be annoyed if this work me up, it's quite early in the morning to send a message to people who may still be sleeping.  
Anyway, I just wanted to feedback because there's clearly an issue here that may be costing our already underfunded and much needed GP practices up to 4 times more money than necessary and I'm hoping there is a quick fix! Fingers crossed this helps in some way. And again, I just wanted to say I think it's great that the practices are sending out messages in this way at a time when physical contact must be kept to a minimum, it's a great way to communicate effectively and efficiently.  
[Very unhappy with 'Keeping in touch']  
  
[Very happy with 'Explanations']

readBy.name: Sarah Champion's Office, MP for Rotherham

author: grannie6
title: Pre assessment with lovely staff
body: was made to feel so at ease. had a lovely nurse Kathryn harrower who was lovely and made my visit easy. just feel these ladies and gents should get a wee recognition as well.

author: Shibainus
title: MRI Scan today with my favourite music
body: The staff were amazing and made me feel soooo good and relaxed made a procedure I was so worried about not a procedure at all. Thank you sooooo much for my most favourite ‘rap music’ although you should not have been listening to the ‘naughty’ words!!!. Thank you I so appreciated it.xxx

author: mercuryyj68
title: I found the staff very pleasant indeed
body: I was very happy about going into hospital because I know just how ill I was, I found the staff very pleasant indeed. This included the cleaning staff as well as the nursing staff. I was impressed by the dedication they displayed for my care, ever being woken at 5. 00am for B. P. They were outstanding and I am proud to say I treated like a king. God bless you all!

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: festivitywb86
title: Very good staff
body:
I have done 7 years here 5 years on Blake. 2 Years and a bit Canterbury.  
On this ward the TeD staff Tanya - Simon - Norman have got me on Fresh Air a lot as well as Pool and Bingo. They are caring and support me.  
They ask how my mum is  
The staff are very good.  
They put their lives at risk to care for me in here  
A big thank you NHS staff

author: Burton Dad
title: Access to support during lock down
body: I have been hearing from others about the support they have received during lock down. Obviously no one has received any face to face support, but lots of people have received telephone and online support.   I am frustrated that the CAMHS service who are supporting my son,   Nottinghamshire NHS Foundation Trust have not provided anything at all.   There has been no telephone support, no offer of online support and we can't even access the CAMHS service to collect prescriptions, they have to post them which takes for ever.     I understand that after three months of lockdown Nottinghamshire NHS Foundation Trust CAMHS are starting to experiment with Microsoft Teams for the delivery of assessment and treatment.   The thing I can't get my head around is why it has taken three months for this to happen.   Once lockdown happened, everything moved online very quickly, hospital, services, etc so why has it taken an NHS trust three months to get its act together and what does that say about the importance it places on supporting vulnerable children and their families?

title: Excellent care and support
body:
Extremely happy with doctor's advice and care.
Had a recurring problem and was diagnosed and treated here very quickly. 
Staff/reception was also very efficient when I called in.

author: handsetpm74
title: Everybody was so helpful
body:
The service I got was really excellent and had to really appreciate, and have to really thank for the staff.  
Everybody was so helpful.  
Thanks again to the great team

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: scutumnn43
title: Lovely Nurse & Cardiology
body:
Lovely Nurse & Cardiology  
Made you very welcome after they introduced themselves - had to praise her for putting the needle in to take bloods, she was the first that I never felt the needle being inserted, made me relaxed when first went and explained everything she was doing,

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Quick  professional service.
body:
Arrived at 1.30am was seen within an hour, blood tests done then given medication and released by 4.30.
All staff were friendly and apologised for not allowing my wife to be with me. My wife called twice from the car and said the receptionist was lovely, helpful and informative. Very impressed with service from start to finish in these challenging times.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: ospreypy53
title: Helped me make changes
body:
I have been supported by Michelle at Stars, for my alcohol use.  
She has educated me,  
motivated me,  
and enabled me,  
to make changes in my life  
thank you

title: Very welcoming
body: Had blood taken at this practice this month felt very safe very nice nurse not my usual practice nice and friendly many thanks 😊

title: Excellent care.   Thank you
body: Today I had to visit a&e at the Lgi.  I was so impressed with the care and attention I was given.    Many changes in place due to covid.     I have to say the atmosphere was so calm and I after many visits to a&e over the years with family members this was the best experience I have ever had there.      All the staff were friendly, caring and professional.    I would like to say thank you to everyone who looked after me today

title: Excellent practice
body:
This is a super practice where you are treated courteously. Doctors discuss your care and give you as much information as possible to allow you to make choices.
Highly recommend.

title: Wonderful care
body: I had a perforated appendix which was assessed and diagnosed by the A&E team, admitted to hospital that evening and operated the next day.  The surgical team visited each morning when I was on the ward and the nursing staff were outstanding in their care and compassion across all patients in my ward, especially welcome as my brief time in hospital coincided with the (then) ongoing covid-19 pandemic where no visitors were allowed.  Caring, dedicated and professional are the words that sum them up.  Heart-felt thanks to all.

title: Great practice
body: Always helpful & willing to listen & understand concerns. Have changed doctor several times but same service with whoever your seen by

title: How many practitioners are working through the…
body:
Today I tried to arrange an appointment to address an injury that has lead to me being in sufficient pain to keep me awake at night.

I called the appointment line at 08:00:00 and got through to both the weekend reply, "the surgery is closed...", and "your call is in a queue.  Then promptly got cut off.

I redialled and got through at 08:00:23, (call history on the mobile phone).

I was 47th in the queue, so 46 others had called in less than 23 seconds.

I held on, migrating from 47th to 23rd in a little under 10 minutes and was cut off again.

I hit redial and was informed that all appointments were taken for the day.

OK another day with disrupted sleep and constant pain.

Consider:

If 24 calls were answered in 10 minutes we can be generous and say that each was resolved in 20 seconds.  That would add 1 call to the 47 that there was in the original queue.

A queue reduction of 24 patients with appointments that day and all of the appointments were filled would seem inadequate for a Monday in a practice that is responsible for 10s of thousands of patients.

If we think that 25 patients will be seen today and a doctor would work for 5 hours a day, then 1 doctor could allocate 12 minutes per patient.

Working 7 hours a day would increase that to almost 17 minutes per patient.  Two doctors would allocate over 30 minutes per patient.

Is 1 or even 2 doctors adequate coverage for a practice that has a coverage of over half of Stourbridge?

Allocating all available appointments from a call list open for less than 30 seconds is not acceptable.

title: Lovely surgery
body:
Reception staff are lovely and Dr's very helpful.  Surprised by some of the reviews I've read.  Receptionists have always been lovely and helpful.  A couple of occasions I have witnessed them being spoken to like dirt which is very unfair as they work so hard and are so helpful.

Would recommend this practise to family to friends

title: Very confusing
body: I trust some of the doctors, nurses and most pharmacists and 2 or 3 of the receptionists. i hardly trust the manager though as she's constantly lying and changing her mind and she never listens to her patients

title: On line consult pointless
body: The new online consult is a complete waste of time at this practice if you then have to still have a telephone consultation and wait nearly two weeks for it

title: Horrible staff and service
body:
the way i was treated and spoken to on the 136 suite was horrible.
being spoken to like dirt and being pulled up to leave when I was in a very bad state (a state i have never been in before and was really scary for me i thought they had poisoned my drink and i was dying) i was banging my head against the wall and they just watched, how is it a place of safety if they don't care that someone is harming them selfs.
i was never assessed and they let me leave without an assessment where as they should of waited untill I was out of the state and done the assessment later, they must of prejudged me from my records as they didn't care about doing an assessment when that was the reason I was kept there. It's disgusting how they prejudge people and do nothing to help.
i hope one day they are treated how bad I was treated and suffer with their mental health then they will know how it feels!

title: left without answers
body:
My daughter spent the whole day with you, doctor suspected  colitis and recommended a follow up colonoscopy and biopsy.  My daughter was taken off to a ward and left in a room on her own for several hours and waited 3 hours for a drink! She had already had severe abdominal pain for 3 days and was given 2 paracetamol!!! She was examined, very quickly, as the doctor was  busy with another patient, my daughter was a patient too... Doctor had no time to write discharge papers so we have no info for our own 
GP, who might have been able to help her further. I collected my daughter at approx. 9.30pm, brought down to the main entrance by a porter who took over 30 mins to arrive...she had 7 days worth of antibiotics, no pain relief, no advice on what to eat or drink and what must be avoided and no mention of any follow up appointment!! She has had another very painful and distressing night and I have had to resort to online help as it seems to be my only option. I have had a lot of treatment at Arrowe Park over the years and I cannot fault the help I received but yesterday reduced us both to tears and despair. I am sorry to say that we feel very let down and disappointed, and my daughter felt even worse when she got home, in her own words, ''what a waste of a day''.

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
